info.title: Test iNaturalist Version 2 API
info.description: ## https://api.inaturalist.org/v2 **UNDER ACTIVE DEVELOPMENT, USE OF THIS ALPHA RELEASE NOT RECOMMENDED** These API methods return data in JSON/JSONP and PNG response formats. Visit our [developers page](https://www.inaturalist.org/pages/developers) for more information. Write operations that expect and return JSON describe a single `body` parameter that represents the request body, which should be specified as JSON. See the "Model" of each body parameter for attributes that we accept in these JSON objects. Multiple values for a single URL parameter should be separated by commas, e.g. `taxon_id=1,2,3`. Map tiles are generated using the [node-mapnik](https://github.com/mapnik/node-mapnik) library, following the XYZ map tiling scheme. The "Observation Tile" methods accept nearly all the parameters of the observation search APIs, and will generate map tiles reflecting the same observations returned by searches. These "Observation Tile" methods have corresponding [UTFGrid](https://github.com/mapbox/utfgrid-spec) JSON responses which return information needed to make interactive maps. Authentication in the Node API is handled via JSON Web Tokens (JWT). To obtain one, make an [OAuth-authenticated request](http://www.inaturalist.org/pages/api+reference#auth) to . Each JWT will expire after 24 hours. Authentication is required for all PUT and POST requests. Some GET requests will also include private information like hidden coordinates if the authenticated user has permission to view them. ## Specifying Response Fields By default, all endpoints will return a very minimal response for the requested resources (e.g. the contents of the `results` array), usually just the UUID. To receive more data, include the `fields` parameter to specify exactly what you want from these resources. For GET requests, this can be as simple as [https://api.inaturalist.org/v2/observations?fields=species_guess,observed_on](https://api.inaturalist.org/v2/observations?fields=species_guess,observed_on) to return the `species_guess` and `observed_on` fields of the observations. For more complex responses, including nested objects, you have two options: ### RISON You can encode the fields parameter as [RISON](https://github.com/w33ble/rison-node), a URL-friendly variant of JSON. If you want to request fields like ```json { "species_guess": true, "user": { "login": true } } ``` you can encode those fields as RISON: https://api.inaturalist.org/v2/observations?fields=(species_guess:!t,user:(login:!t)) This is our preferred way to specify fields because it maintains the caching benefits of URLs that are unique to their responses, and it avoids the complexity of overriding the HTTP request method. ### X-HTTP-Method-Override If specifying the fields in RISON still results in a URL that is too large or unwieldy, all GET endpoints also support POST requests with the `X-HTTP-Method-Override: GET` header to so you can specify the response fields in stringified JSON, e.g. ``` curl -XPOST \ -H "X-HTTP-Method-Override: GET" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{"fields": {"species_guess": true, "user": {"login": true}}}' \ "https://api.inaturalist.org/v2/observations" ``` When making `multipart/form-data` POST requests, you can still specify `fields` as part of the form data, either as a commma-separated list of field names or a JSON string. To see all available fields, you can use `fields=all`, e.g. Photos served from https://static.inaturalist.org and https://inaturalist-open-data.s3.amazonaws.com have multiple size variants and not all size variants are returned in responses. To access other sizes, the photo URL can be modified to replace only the size qualifier (each variant shares the exact same extension). The domain a photo is hosted under reflects the license under which the photo is being shared, and the domain may change over time if the license changes. Photos in the `inaturalist-open-data` domain are shared under open licenses. These can be accessed in bulk in the [iNaturalist AWS Open Dataset]( https://registry.opendata.aws/inaturalist-open-data/). Photos in the `static.inaturalist.org` domain do not have open licenses. The available photo sizes are: * original (max 2048px in either dimension) * large (max 1024px in either dimension) * medium (max 500px in either dimension) * small (max 240px in either dimension) * thumb (max 100px in either dimension) * square (75px square) ## About iNaturalist [iNaturalist](https://www.inaturalist.org/) is a global community of naturalists, scientists, and members of the public sharing over a million wildlife sightings to teach one another about the natural world while creating high quality citizen science data for science and conservation. iNaturalist Website: Open Source Software: ## Terms of Use Use of this API is subject to the iNaturalist [Terms of Service](https://www.inaturalist.org/terms) and [Privacy Policy](https://www.inaturalist.org/privacy). We will block any use of our API that violates our Terms or Privacy Policy without notice. The API is intended to support application development, not data scraping. For pre- generated data exports, see . Please note that we throttle API usage to a max of 100 requests per minute, though we ask that you try to keep it to 60 requests per minute or lower, and to keep under 10,000 requests per day. If we notice usage that has serious impact on our performance we may institute blocks without notification. Terms of Service: Privacy Policy:

icon_url.description: URL of an icon image for the site

locale.description: Default language code for users of this site

place_id.description: Integer ID of the default search place for this site

faved_project_ids.description: Ordered list of IDs of projects the user has faved

prefers_community_taxa.description: Whether the user allows the Community Taxon to be the taxon their observation is associated with

official.description: Whether this application is controlled by iNaturalist itself

scopes.description: List of scopes granted to this application. `login` provides access to information required for logging into a third-party service like user ID, email address, profile pic, etc. `write` allows the application to post content to iNat as the user; `account_delete` allows the application to delete the user's iNat account.

photos_locked.description: Whether or not photos for this taxon can be edited

items.description: TODO: status can be strings or objects

score.description:
Common ancestor scores are not directly comparable to the combined_score
    of results. Generally they are similar, factoring in both vision and spatial
    similarity, but are derived from a subset of the top results resulting in
    a value different than combined_score. Usually the common ancestor score
    will be above 70 as taxa need to have a high confidence in order to be
    considered a likely common ancestor.

CommonAncestor.description:
Common ancestor taxon of some of the top results weighted by combined score.
  If present, it generally has a much higher chance of being accurate (if not
  precise), often by as much as 30-40 percentage points.

id.description: Unique auto-increment integer identifier for the reference.

reference_uuid.description: External UUID for the referenced object (e.g. identification or comment), if available.

reference_source.description: Origin of the reference, e.g. 'observation' or 'identification'.

reference_observation_id.description: Observation ID associated with the reference, if any.

reference_date.description: When the referenced content was created, if known.

reference_content.description: Captured text from the referenced content (e.g. a comment body).

user_id.description: User ID associated with the reference, if any.

user_login.description: User login associated with the reference, if any.

id.description: Unique auto-increment integer identifier for the IdSummary.

photo_tip.description: Plain-language tip describing what to photograph to capture key ID features.

score.description: Overall score for the summary, if available.

references.description: References (observations, identifications, comments, etc.) that support this summary.

occurrence_status_level.description: Assessment of occurrence frequency in this place. 60 = present, 50 = common, 40 = uncommon, 30 = irregular, 20 = doubtful, 10 = absent

establishment_means.description: How this taxon became established in this place

manually_added.description: Whether this taxon was added to this list by a person or not

primary_listing.description: Whether or not this is the primary listing for this taxon in this place (places can have multiple checklists that contain the same taxa)

establishment_means_label.description: Localized version of the establishment means

establishment_means_description.description: Localized description of the establishment means

value.description: TODO: values can be single values or arrays

value_keyword.description: TODO: values can be single values or arrays

viewer_trusted_by_observer.description: Observer trusts the authenticated user with access to hidden coordinates

faved_project_ids.description: Ordered list of IDs of projects the user has faved

prefers_observation_fields_by.description: Allows this kind of user to add observation field values to their observations

prefers_project_addition_by.description: Allows this kind of user to add their observations to projects

prefers_scientific_name_first.description: Prefers to view scientific names before common names

provider_name.description: Name of the provider from a controlled vocabulary. The `open_id` means Yahoo in this context

provider_uid.description: Unique identifier for the user from the provider

scope.description: Comma-separated list of OAuth scopes granted by the provider

following.description: Whether the user notifications about new content made by the friend

trust.description: Whether the user trusts the friend with hidden coordinates

reciprocal_trust.description: Whether the friend trusts the user with hidden coordinates

combined_score.description:
Combination of the vision and frequency scores, i.e. a score that
      incorporates visual similarity and spatial similarity

frequency_score.description:
This value used to be any float value between 0 and 1 reflecting a
      measure of spatial similarity to observations of this taxon.
      Currently frequency_score can only be 0 meaning the taxon is not expected
      nearby, or 1 meaning the taxon is expected to be nearby. These values
      are derived from the iNaturalist Geomodel trained on iNaturalist
      observation locations.

vision_score.description:
Score based on the visual similarity of the provided photo to photos of
      taxa in the computer vision model.

results.description:
Scores are provided without units and are intended for sorting the
    suggestions. One type of score is not necessarily comparable to another,
    e.g. a taxon with a vision_score of 30 should not necessarily be shown
    before one with a frequency_score of 1. None of the scores are probabilities of
    accuracy. Score ranges will vary from observation to observation (e.g. a
    result with combined_score of 80 for one observation is not equally as
    likely a result with the same score for a different observation). Within
    results for a single observation, scores reflect relative confidence. In a
    single response, a result with a combined score twice another result is
    more likely to be accurate, but not neseccarily exactly twice as likely.

score.description: Search score; can be used to sort search results

type.description: Type of record for this search result

matches.description: Array of text field values that matched the search query

comprehensiveness.description:
Set when the suggestions are believed to be comprehensive given the search
      parameters, e.g. if retrieving suggestions for squirrels in California,
      these should represent *all* the squirrels known to occur in California.
      If blank or absent, that means the suggestions may or may not be
      comprehensive. Currently only set when `source` is `checklist`

image_url.description: URL for image to use when `source` is `visual`
image_url.title: image_url

lat.description: Coordinate used when fetching nearby results `source` is `visual` or `*observations`

lng.description: Coordinate used when fetching nearby results `source` is `visual` or `*observations`

observation_id.description:
Automatically set place and taxon filters based on this observation; this
      will override the values of `place_id` and `taxon_id` if these values
      can be derived from the observation

observed_on.description:
Date the subject was observed (YYYY-MM-DD), used to refine suggestions to
      those observed at a similar time of year

order_by.description:
How the suggestions will be ordered. The default is to order by whatever default
      a source uses, e.g. the score when `source` is `visual`, or the number of
      observations (frequency) when the `source` is `*observations`. Ordering by
      `taxonomy` will group the results by their closeness in the taxonomic
      tree, but continue to use default ordering for siblings (e.g. species in the
      same genus).

place_id.description:
Only retrieve suggestions from this place when `source` is `checklist`
      or `*observations`

place_lat.description:
Coordinate used to set a place filter when source is `*observations` by
      choosing the place whose boundary contains the coordinate. Only chooses
      from places curated by staff (aka "standard" places) and only sets the
      place when lat, lng, and place_id are blank

source.description:
Source of the suggestions. Note that different sources support different
      search parameters. See each parameter for details

taxon_id.description:
Only retrieve suggestions in this taxon. If taxon is below genus level it
      will be replaced with the genus that contains it. When `source` is
      `misidentifications`, suggestions will be species commonly misidentified
      as this taxon

query.description:
Query parameters used to generate these results. When `source` is
      `*observations` this may have some additional parameters used to set
      defaults for the observations query.

active.description: Whether this summary is the active one for its taxon.

taxon_photo_attribution.description: Attribution text from the associated photo.

taxon_photo_observation_id.description: Observation ID associated with the taxon photo, when the photo comes from an observation.

language.description: ISO language code for the summary content.

run_name.description: Label for the run that produced this summary.

run_generated_at.description: Timestamp when the run generated this content.

id_summaries.description: Child IdSummaries for this taxon, each with optional supporting references.

wikipedia_summary.description: Summary description of this taxon from Wikipedia

score.description: Search score; can be used to sort search results

type.description: Type of record for this search result

matches.description: Array of text field values that matched the search query

parent_type.description: Type of record being commented on

parent_id.description: UUID of record being commented on

taxon_id.description: ID taxa must match the given taxa or their descendants

quality_grade.description: Observation must have this quality grade

taxon_id.description: ID taxa must match the given taxa or their descendants

quality_grade.description: Observation must have this quality grade
Observation must have this quality grade

current.description: Setting to false means the identification is withdrawn

message.description: What happened that was worth logging

context.description: Brief description of where the log event came from, e.g. a file or class name

timestamp.description: Datetime the event was logged in the client in case of asynchronous logging

error_type.description: Type of error, e.g. java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError. Only used when level is error

backtrace.description: Only used when level is error

extra.description: Accepts key/values where the values are not objects, and logs the contents

LogCreate.description: Log an event that occurred in a client application

photo_id.description: Sequential ID for the existing photo

uuid.description: New UUID for the photo, helps prevent duplication in poor network conditions

observation_photo[uuid].description: New UUID for the photo, helps prevent duplication in poor network conditions

species_guess.description: The name of the organism observed. If the taxon ID is absent, iNat will try to choose a single taxon based on this string, but it may fail if there's some taxonomic amgiguity.

acc.description: Filter by whether `positional_accuracy` is set or not

endemic.description: Filter by whether the observation is in a place with a check list entry indicating the establishment means is `endemic`

threatened.description: Filter by whether the observed taxon has a conservation status of "threatened" or worse

verifiable.description: Filter by whether observations are 'verifiable' (have quality grades `research` or `needs_id`)

licensed.description: Filter by observations where the license attribute is not null, i.e. it is licensed

photo_licensed.description: Filter by observations where the license attribute of at least one photo is not null

coords_viewable_for_proj.description: Filter by observers who trust the project(s) specified in `project_id` OR trust the authenticated viewer

obscuration.description: Filter by observations where the `geoprivacy` or `taxon_geoprivacy` match these values

identifications.description:
Filter by level of agreement among identifications:

* **most_agree:** returns observations where there are more active identifications of taxa that agree with the Observation Taxon than active identifications that disagree with the Observation Taxon
* **some_agree:** returns observations where there are some active identifications of taxa that agree with the Observation Taxon
* **most_disagree:** returns observations where there are more active identifications of taxa that disagree with the Observation Taxon than active identifications that agree with the Observation Taxon

disagreements.description: Whether there is disagreement among active identifications

fails_dqa_accurate.description: Filter by observations voted as not accurately depicting an organism or scene

fails_dqa_date.description: Filter by observations voted as not having an accurate date

fails_dqa_evidence.description: Filter by observations voted as not evidence of an organism

fails_dqa_location.description: Filter by observations voted as not having an accurate location

fails_dqa_needs_id.description: Filter by observations voted as the community ID cannot be improved

fails_dqa_recent.description: Filter by observations voted as not recent evidence of an organism

fails_dqa_subject.description: Filter by observations voted as not having evidence related to a single subject

fails_dqa_wild.description: Filter by observations voted as not wild

fields.description: Attribute fields to return in the response

species_guess.description: The name of the organism observed. If the taxon ID is absent, iNat will try to choose a single taxon based on this string, but it may fail if there's some taxonomic amgiguity.

created_after.description: ISO8601 datetime after which the update was created

viewed.description: When false this only returns updates that have not been viewed by the authenticated user. When true it returns all updates.

observations_by.description: Restrict to updates on observations by the authenticated user (owner) or on observations the authenticated user is following

prefers_curator_coordinate_access.description: Whether the observer allows project curators to view the coordinates of this observation

skip_counts.description: If counts are not needed, consider setting this to true to save on processing time, resulting in faster responses

fields.description: Attribute fields to return in the response

user_id.description: Related user must have this ID

trusted.description: Whether or not the user trusts the friend with hidden coordinates.

following.description: Whether or not the user wants to see updates about new content from the friend.

put.description:
Updates attributes that persist for the duration of a user's session.

get.summary: Suggest taxa for identifications given conditions
get.description: Retrieve automated identification suggestions for an observation or a set of filters like taxon and place

parameters.name: featured_observation_id
parameters.description: When `source` is `observations`, ignore this observation

parameters.name: image_url
parameters.description: URL for image to use when `source` is `visual`

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Coordinate used when fetching nearby results `source` is `visual` or `*observations`

parameters.name: lng
parameters.description: Coordinate used when fetching nearby results `source` is `visual` or `*observations`

parameters.name: observation_id
parameters.description:
Automatically set place and taxon filters based on this observation; this
      will override the values of `place_id` and `taxon_id` if these values
      can be derived from the observation

parameters.name: observed_on
parameters.description:
Date the subject was observed (YYYY-MM-DD), used to refine suggestions to
      those observed at a similar time of year

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description:
How the suggestions will be ordered. The default is to order by whatever default
      a source uses, e.g. the score when `source` is `visual`, or the number of
      observations (frequency) when the `source` is `*observations`. Ordering by
      `taxonomy` will group the results by their closeness in the taxonomic
      tree, but continue to use default ordering for siblings (e.g. species in the
      same genus).

parameters.name: place_id
parameters.description:
Only retrieve suggestions from this place when `source` is `checklist`
      or `*observations`

parameters.name: place_lat
parameters.description:
Coordinate used to set a place filter when source is `*observations` by
      choosing the place whose boundary contains the coordinate. Only chooses
      from places curated by staff (aka "standard" places) and only sets the
      place when lat, lng, and place_id are blank

parameters.name: place_lng
parameters.description: See `place_lat`

parameters.name: source
parameters.description:
Source of the suggestions. Note that different sources support different
      search parameters. See each parameter for details

parameters.name: taxon_id
parameters.description:
Only retrieve suggestions in this taxon. If taxon is below genus level it
      will be replaced with the genus that contains it. When `source` is
      `misidentifications`, suggestions will be species commonly misidentified
      as this taxon

timestamp.description: Datetime the event was logged in the client in case of asynchronous logging

error_type.description: Type of error, e.g. java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError. Only used when level is error

backtrace.description: Only used when level is error

extra.description: Accepts key/values where the values are not objects, and logs the contents

parameters.name: metric
parameters.description:
The metric being voted on.

            date: Whether or not the date seems accurate.
            evidence: Whether the media presents evidence for the presence of the organism.
            location: Whether the location seems accurate.
            needs_id: Whether the observation should remain in the Needs ID category.
            recent: Whether the evidence demonstrates that the organism was present recently.
            wild: Whether the individual organism was where and when it was without human intervention.
            subject: Whether the media evidence is related to a single subject.

parameters.name: threatened
parameters.description: Filter by whether the observed taxon has a conservation status of "threatened" or worse

parameters.name: verifiable
parameters.description: Filter by whether observations are 'verifiable' (have quality grades `research` or `needs_id`)

parameters.name: licensed
parameters.description: Filter by observations where the license attribute is not null, i.e. it is licensed

parameters.name: photo_licensed
parameters.description: Filter by observations where the license attribute of at least one photo is not null

parameters.name: coords_viewable_for_proj
parameters.description: Filter by observers who trust the project(s) specified in `project_id` OR trust the authenticated viewer

parameters.name: obscuration
parameters.description: Filter by observations where the `geoprivacy` or `taxon_geoprivacy` match these values

parameters.name: identifications
parameters.description:
Filter by level of agreement among identifications:

* **most_agree:** returns observations where there are more active identifications of taxa that agree with the Observation Taxon than active identifications that disagree with the Observation Taxon
* **some_agree:** returns observations where there are some active identifications of taxa that agree with the Observation Taxon
* **most_disagree:** returns observations where there are more active identifications of taxa that disagree with the Observation Taxon than active identifications that agree with the Observation Taxon

parameters.name: disagreements
parameters.description: Whether there is disagreement among active identifications

parameters.name: fails_dqa_accurate
parameters.description: Filter by observations voted as not accurately depicting an organism or scene

parameters.name: fails_dqa_date
parameters.description: Filter by observations voted as not having an accurate date

parameters.name: fails_dqa_evidence
parameters.description: Filter by observations voted as not evidence of an organism

parameters.name: fails_dqa_location
parameters.description: Filter by observations voted as not having an accurate location

parameters.name: fails_dqa_needs_id
parameters.description: Filter by observations voted as the community ID cannot be improved

parameters.name: fails_dqa_recent
parameters.description: Filter by observations voted as not recent evidence of an organism

parameters.name: fails_dqa_subject
parameters.description: Filter by observations voted as not having evidence related to a single subject

parameters.name: fails_dqa_wild
parameters.description: Filter by observations voted as not wild

parameters.name: thresholded
parameters.description: Set to true to render only cells above the Seen Nearby threshold
